section.title: Override data elements' category combinations in a data set
section.para: You can override which category combination to use for a data element within the context of a data set. This means that a data element can use different category combinations within different data sets. This is useful when you want to reuse a data element since you don't have to replicate the data element to allow multiple category combinations.

example.para: If different regions within your organisation unit hierarchy use different disaggregations, or if the disaggregations change over time, you can represent this by creating different data sets with the appropriate category combinations.

listitem.para: Open the Maintenance app and click Data set > Data set.
In the list, find the data set you want to modify.
Click the options menu and select Edit.
Go to the data elements section and click the spanner icon.
Select new category combinations and click Close.
